tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
    rule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    source_ip VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    destination_ip VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    port INT NOT NULL,
    protocol VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules (
    rule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    rule_description TEXT,
    rule_protocol VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
    rule_port INT NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE firewall_config (id INT PRIMARY KEY, rule_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, rule_description TEXT NOT NULL, rule_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, rule_enabled BOOLEAN NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE firewall_rules_config (
    rule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    rule_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    rule_description TEXT,
    rule_priority INT,
    rule_allow BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE rule_conditions (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  condition_name VARCHAR(255),
  condition_type VARCHAR(50),
  condition_value VARCHAR(255),
  rule_id INT REFERENCES firewall_settings(id)
);

CREATE TABLE access_logs (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  access_type VARCHAR(50),
  user_id INT,
  rule_id INT REFERENCES firewall_settings(id)
);
